column4: guys can someone give me a tried and tested guide on setting up wireless on jaunty with a broadcom 4306/3 chipset? this is driving me nuts now :(
I thought I used bwcutter on that.
I dont know how to get it working. It says wrong input file or something along those lines...
but older distros of ubuntu supported my wireless better, i didnt need to use bcm cutter
are there any tutorials or orum posts that may be of help?
Here are my old notes.. http://paste.ubuntu.com/189878/
Okay, so if I follow these instructions, my card should work, yeah?
It would be what I would try
okay, and do i need any sort of pre requisites, any additional software etc?
I have not put any of my bcm4308's on a jaunty box yet
do i still need to install ndiswrapper?
I dont think so.  but it has been a long time and I am way tired atm
okay, well i can always give it a go and report back. thanks very much!
